author: sky.cactus
content: I definitely wouldn't call them "non validating" nodes.  They are 100% validating nodes.

author: sky.cactus
content: As far as clients go, either you run a validator client or you don't.

author: sky.cactus
content: Your execution client is either stateless or it isn't.

author: sky.cactus
content:
Do you think we need different name for each of the following?
* someone who runs a stateless execution client plus a validator
*someone who runs a stateful execution client and a validator
* someone who runs a stateless execution client and no validator
* someone who runs a stateful execution client and no validator

author: sky.cactus
content: It is a bit of a combinatorial explosion when you try to name all combinations.

author: sky.cactus
content: I would just say, "are you stateless or not" and keep that separate from "are you running a validator client"?

author: sky.cactus
content: I like "staking statefull" and "nonstaking stateless".  That way we have two terms with negators, and they can combine in any combination.

author: sky.cactus
content: No need to mention "validator" in there, as I think that just adds confusion since users think of "staking" when they often mean (under current terminology) "running a validator client".
